page.title: 07JUNIOR SCHOOL, SOUTHWELL (1)
page.content: Lowes Wong Junior{School}was founded in 1967. The Headmaster,Mr.T.Bowler is the second to be appointed. The School for boys and girls from the age of seven to eleven. It was built because the{population}of Southwell grew,and so the need for more premises became more urgent. The name "Lowes Wong" requires some explanation. The word "Wong" is a of Scandinavian origin and is a common element in{Nottinghanshire's}field names, referring to a piece of unenclosed meadow land.The Lowe family leased Dunham Prebend for about one hundred and years and the adjoining wong was let with the house.Tht major part of the wong now comprises of the school grounds. There are three hundred and eighty three children, about half boys and girls.
